body:
I did not want to edit the original issue, so I added a new comment to enhance.

## Summary of the new feature/enhancement
As the [current VpnClient module](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/vpnclient/?view=windowsserver2019-ps) on Windows platform includes `Get`, `Set`, `New`, `Add` & `Remove` verbs, an `Invoke` verb seems like the missing piece.

## Proposed technical implementation details (optional)

Establishes a VPN connection using an existing VPN configuration.
```
Invoke-VpnConnection 
[-Name] <String>
[-Credential] <System.Management.Automation.PSCredential>
```
### Description
The **Invoke-VpnConnection** command checks the VPN configuration by name and establishes a connection by a saved configuration. It can use the credentials or certificate defined in the configuration by default.  If a certificate or credential is not configured, the default is the current user.

If there is not a VPN configuration with the Name property, it throws an error:
`VPN connection test was not found. : The system could not find the phone book entry for this connection.`

If the connection fails, It throws an error related to the exception: Incorrect Credentials, Network Connection Failure etc.

It requires the whole VpnClient module to be cross platform.

### Parameters
`-Name`
Specifies the name of this VPN connection profile.

| Type:                                      | String |
| :--- | :--- | 
| Position:                                 | 1                          |
| Aliases:                                   | None                   |
| Default value:                         | None                  |
| Accept pipeline input:            | True                    |
| Accept wildcard characters:   | False                   |

`-Credential`
Optional. Specifies a user account that have permission to perform this action. If a certificate or credential is not configured, the default is the current user.

| Type:                                      | PSCredential |
| :--- | :--- | 
| Position:                                 | Named                |
| Aliases:                                   | None                   |
| Default value:                         | None                  |
| Accept pipeline input:            | False                   |
| Accept wildcard characters:   | False                   |

### Examples
#### Example 1
`Get-VpnConnection | Invoke-VpnConnection`
Gets the only VPN connection defined and establishes a connection using stored credentials. If credentials are not defined in the VPN Configuration, it falls back to current logged in user.

#### Example 2
`Invoke-VpnConnection -Name "Fabrikam" -Credential (Get-Credential)`
Establishes a new VPN connection by name overriding the saved credentials, if exists.

### Inputs
**None**

This cmdlet does not take any object as input.

### Outputs
**None**

This cmdlet does not generate any output.

A `Connect-Disconnect` pair might be a better option, yet 
`Connect-VpnConnection` sounds like a duplicate. Since 
`Start-Stop` pair is used for asynchronous operations, it does not fit well. Also, `Enable-Disable` might be a better option.
